ro.unitbv.pythia

Class FuzzyArt

  • java.lang.Object
    • ro.unitbv.pythia.FuzzyArt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class FuzzyArt
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    This is a standard implementation of the Fuzzy ART model, as introduced by Gail Carpenter et al.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • findCategory

        public int findCategory()
        Find and return category J for which T[J] is maximum and threshold test is passed. If no such category exists, this method returns -1
        Returns:
        the index of winning category; -1 if no winner is found

      • createNewCategory

        public void createNewCategory()
        Add a new category to the network

      • learn

        public void learn(int J)
        Update w[J], based on the old value and the current input.
        Parameters:
        J - the index of input category for which learning occurs

      • increaseRho

        public void increaseRho(int J)
        Called in match tracking phase.
        Parameters:
        J - the index of winning category

      • restoreRho

        public void restoreRho()
        Used to restore value of rho at the baseline value. Called when match tracking takes place.

      • getRho

        public double getRho()
        Returns:
        the current vigilance value

      • giveNumberInCategories

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> giveNumberInCategories()
        Returns the list of how many training patterns were associated with each input category
        Returns:
        The list of how many training patterns were associated with each input category

      • giveCentroid

        public double[] giveCentroid(int j)
        Returns the centroid corresponding to category j
        Parameters:
        j - the index of the category whose centroid is to be returned
        Returns:
        the centroid

        public int numCategories()
        Return number of categories
